crib_f2: Items Ranked at Highest Extreme
text: Scientists should stop falsely claiming that climate change is a settled science.
com_f2:
Most salient aspect of this perspective is a epistemic denial. Emphasis on a miscontrued science and understanding. Many qual comments
"There is no such thing as settled science"
"it is a load of bullshit thought up by some brain dead idiots in university"
"No one has lived longer than 100 years so no one including know what the weather was like 500 years ago.I believe it is cyclical due to varying earth rotations"

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the United Nations.
com_f2: Not merely scientists [2,], but perpetuated by the UN

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: They changed the name from "global warming" to "climate change" because the planet isn't warming.
com_f2: Combined with [2], emphasises epistemic denial

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The concept of global warming was created by and for the Chinese in order to make U.S. manufacturing non-competitive.
com_f2: Ulterior motive. Climate change threatens other nations for the benefits of others.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Australian agriculture is thriving so climate change can't be real.
com_f2: Combined with [2], climate change cannot be real because evidence contradicts theory

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Those who demand climate action are the usual "torch-and-pitchfork" crowd.
com_f2: Climate change mitigation is ineffective/harmful [1]. Qual comments: "Just like any other protest people need to calm down"

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Oil and gas companies could not care less about climate change.
com_f2: With [24], still a demonstration of vested interests. One that happens to serve this profiles own interest [1]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Cow farts cause more 'climate change' than human activity.
com_f2: Specific causes less relevant than the overall ambigiuty [2]. The profile seems more closely tied to a form of denial where nothing can be known about the climate.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: No political party can say they have a climate change action plan when they favour coal, oil, and gas companies.
com_f2: With [29], still a demonstration of vested interests. One that happens to serve this profiles own interest [1]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Countries must fulfil their Paris Climate Agreement goals.
com_f2: Possibly some loyalty. Nevertheless, statements in this category are generally disagreed with

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Australian politicians need to wake up to the emergency of tackling climate change.
com_f2: Majority of participants disagreed with this statement.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: It is shameful that climate change, the greatest problem of our time, is barely discussed in the media.
com_f2: These statements are the most difficuilt to interpret within this perspective.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Regardless of who is elected, the reality is that climate change is going to destroy everything.
com_f2: These statements are the most difficuilt to interpret within this perspective.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Poor people will be impacted the worst by climate change.
com_f2: Benign, compared to [8] which is vehemently denied

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Politicians and the mass media are ignorant about the risks of climate change.
com_f2: These statements are the most difficuilt to interpret within this perspective.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change sceptics ignore basic climate science facts.
com_f2: Despite this profile being strongly sceptical, this statement is within the middle of the distribution.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Politicians who refuse to tackle climate change are just as bad as those who deny climate science.
com_f2: The morality judgement here may lead to disagreement.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change policy and renewable energy (e.g., solar power) should be a major focus of Australian political elections.
com_f2: More agreeable than the proposed risks of climate change

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: People who deny the science of climate change should not hold public office.
com_f2: Despite this profile being strongly sceptical, this statement is within the middle of the distribution.

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Through cutting science funding, we damage Australia's ability to respond to climate change.
com_f2: Nonsensical within this profile, given [2]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The Great Barrier Reef is at risk from climate change.
com_f2: The climate isn't changing [17]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The increased occurrence of extreme weather events is a clear sign that climate change is real.
com_f2: The climate isn't changing [16]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Australia is experiencing more extreme weather and hotter days due to climate change.
com_f2: Denial of changes, consistent with other statements [16]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change is a threat to the health and safety of our children.
com_f2: Combined with [1], climate change detracts from more important issues. Also see [19]

crib_f2: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The threat of climate change is much worse than climate scientists originally thought.
com_f2: Statement in isolation is difficuilt to interpret in this profile. Those who ranked it (-4) argue climate change isn't anthropogenic.

crib_f2: Items Ranked at Lowest Extreme
text: It is important to vote for leaders who will combat climate change.
com_f2: Not important, probably damaging given [3,6]. Qual comments emphasise the importance for other priorities (e.g., homelessness; "Poverty, Crime, Disease, Drugs. Climate Change is the least of our problems. All politicians are greedy and and only concerned about "what they can get". No one cares about people living below the poverty line, and all the crime in the country. Focus on today. Not "what might happen" in the future."), and that mitigation is impossible ("how do you tame mother nature, money can't")

crib_f2: Not on Crib Sheet
text: We must start working together for real solutions on climate change.
com_f2: These statements are the most difficuilt to interpret within this perspective.

crib_f2: Not on Crib Sheet
text: Climate sceptics, with no genuine expertise, cannot know better than climate scientists.
com_f2: May not be vehemently advocated, as people cannot have a genuine expertise in climate changes [2]

crib_f2: Not on Crib Sheet
text: Climate change and human burning of fossil fuels are strongly linked.
com_f2: Statements at 0 are generally disagreed with.

crib_f2: Not on Crib Sheet
text: We need to keep coal, oil, and gas in the ground and adopt more renewable energy sources, like solar and wind power.
com_f2: Above [19], more opposed to the statement being the topic of election than the technology itself
